trial_identification.studytitle: Use of a CO2 clamp and or CPAP to stabilize respiration in patients with combined central and obstructive sleep apnoea
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Use of a CO2 clamp and or CPAP to stabilize respiration in patients with combined central and obstructive sleep apnoea

interventions.interventions: To test efficacy of device under development in treating combined central and obstructive sleep apnoea as compared to conventional CPAP as control. The subject will undergo one night polysomnography whilst using device and one night polysomnography with CPAP (control) in randomized order 1 week apart. The subject will be requested to wear CPAP at night for one week at home prior to each study night to acclimatize to positive airway pressure and mask.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Resolution of sleep disordered breathing whilst on aforementioned device, compared with placebo (CPAP alone)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement of overnight oxygenation and arousal index as measured by overnight polysomnography (one night) whilst on aforementioned device, compared with placebo.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Presence of central and or obstructive sleep apnoea. Clinically stable 1 month. Willing and competent to sign consent.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Significant psychiatric disease. Claustrophobia. inability to tolerate CPAP via mask overnight.

trial_design.concealment: Intervention is concealed from subject as they are unaware which device is active
